speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Good morning, thank you for calling ISS Insurance Ltd Singapore. My name is Sarah. How may I help you today?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Oh, hello Sarah. Yes, I need to ask about... insurance? For travelling? I'm really quite lost about all this, sorry.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Not a problem at all, I can certainly help guide you through gathering what you need. To start, could you tell me where you'll be travelling to?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, we're planning a trip to Australia.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, Australia. And how long will you be away for?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: We'll be away for 10 days. Leaving from Singapore, of course. We're based in Singapore.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Understood, 10 days to Australia, departing from Singapore. And how many people will be travelling?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: There will be 2 of us travelling.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Alright, two travellers. And roughly, which age group do the travellers fall into? Is it 18-25, 26-40, 41-55, 56-65, or 65+?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Uhm, we're mostly around 41-55 years old.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Got it, 41-55 age group. Do you have a budget in mind for the insurance policy?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: We're hoping to spend maybe around $200-$300? Is that realistic? I don't really know.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, noted the budget range of $200-$300. Now, are there any specific activities you plan to do during your trip? Like any sports or adventure activities?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Activities... well, the main reason we are going is for golf. Lots of golf. Are there... things for golf? I'm a bit worried about my clubs. What if they get lost or broken on the flight? Is that covered?

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, so cover for golf equipment is something you need information on. Lost or damaged. Noted.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes. And, what if, say, I twist my ankle the day before we're supposed to play? We pay for the golf course fees in advance, you see. Can we get that money back if we can't play? The unused green fees?

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Alright, so you're also asking about reimbursement for unused green fees due to unforeseen circumstances. I've made a note of that.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, exactly. And... oh dear, this sounds silly, but those golf buggies you drive on the course? What happens if I accidentally bump it into something and damage it? It's quite worrying.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Understood. So, you need information on coverage related to accidental damage caused to a rented golf buggy.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, please. And one more thing about golf... my friend mentioned some insurance gives a special benefit if you get a hole-in-one? Is that true? It would be amazing, though unlikely for me! But just asking.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, so you're also interested in knowing about any available 'hole-in-one' benefits. Noted. Are there any other activities besides golf?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: No, no other special activities planned. Just the golf and sightseeing.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay. Thinking about the trip more generally, what are some other situations you might be concerned about or want protection for?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Oh, um... well, what happens if one of us gets sick while we're in Australia? Like, needing to see a doctor or ending up in hospital? That sounds expensive.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Alright, so understanding the coverage for medical expenses incurred overseas, like doctor visits or hospital stays, is important for you.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, definitely. And... sorry to ask so many basic questions... but what if something happens *before* we go? Like, if one of us gets very ill suddenly and we have to cancel the whole holiday? Do we lose all the money we paid?

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Noted. You need information on coverage regarding trip cancellation due to unforeseen events like illness before departure.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Right. And what about our normal bags, our suitcases? What if the airline loses them, or they arrive days late? It would be terrible to arrive with nothing.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, so you're also looking for details on coverage for luggage that is lost, damaged, or delayed by the airline.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes. And... uh... flight delays? Sometimes you hear about people getting stuck for a whole day. Does insurance help with... like, needing a hotel room or food if the plane is very, very delayed?

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Understood. Information regarding coverage for significant travel delays, including expenses like accommodation and meals, is also required.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Just a couple more things to ensure we capture everything. Does anyone travelling have any pre-existing medical conditions, like asthma or high blood pressure, that we should be aware of?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Oh, no. No, no pre-existing conditions for either of us.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, thank you. And will you be travelling with any special medical equipment, like a wheelchair or CPAP machine?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: No, nothing like that needed.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Perfect. So, just to quickly summarize what you're looking for information on for your 10-day trip to Australia for two travellers aged 41-55 departing from Singapore, with a budget around $200-$300: You need details on medical coverage overseas, trip cancellation protection, coverage for lost, damaged, or delayed luggage, and help with expenses during significant travel delays. Specifically related to golf, you need information on coverage for golf equipment, reimbursement for unused green fees, liability for golf buggy damage, and potential hole-in-one benefits. Does that sound correct?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, I think... I think that's everything. It sounds like a lot when you say it like that! Sorry if I was confusing.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Not at all, you were very clear. Thank you for providing all those details. That gives us a good understanding of the information you require. I have recorded these requirements.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Okay, good. Thank you for your patience, Sarah.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: You're most welcome. Thank you for calling ISS Insurance Ltd. Have a great day!

speaker: Customer
dialogue: You too. Bye bye.
